alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 12:47PM CST until March 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: .Snow will begin to develop in southwest Nebraska Wednesday afternoon and gradually move south. Worst conditions are expected Wednesday night when snow and blowing snow may cause significant travel difficulties, including Interstate 70. Snow will gradually end west to east through the day on Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 to 55 mph. Wind chill readings could drop as low as -10 to -16. * WHERE...In Kansas, Wichita and Greeley Counties. In Colorado, Cheyenne County. * WHEN...From 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
